837     
838     prompt = f"""You are matching a person to the correct profile from CoreSignal search results.
839 
840 TARGET PERSON TO MATCH:
841 - Full Name: {person_name}
842 - Email: {person_email}
843 - Email Domain: {email_domain if email_domain else 'N/A'}
844 
845 MEETING CONTEXT:
846 - Meeting Title: {meeting_title}
847 - Company/Organization: {company_info}
848 - Other Participants: {', '.join(meeting_context.get('other_participants', []))}
849 
850 CANDIDATES FROM CORESIGNAL ({len(simplified_candidates)} candidates):
851 {candidates_json}
852 
853 MATCHING PRIORITY (in order of importance):
854 1. **EXACT EMAIL MATCH**: If any candidate's email exactly matches "{person_email}" → HIGHEST PRIORITY (confidence 10)
855    - This is the most reliable indicator - always select this if available
856    
857 2. **NAME + EMAIL DOMAIN MATCH**: If candidate's name exactly matches "{person_name}" AND their email domain matches "{email_domain}" → VERY HIGH PRIORITY (confidence 9)
858    - Example: Name is "Daniel Liss" and email ends with "@economicgroup.com"
859    
860 3. **NAME + COMPANY EXACT MATCH**: If candidate's name exactly matches "{person_name}" AND their current company name exactly matches "{company_from_context}" OR its abbreviation "{company_abbreviation}" (if provided) → VERY HIGH PRIORITY (confidence 9)
861    - Example: Name is "Daniel Liss" and company is "Economic Group Pension Services" OR "EGPS" (both refer to the same company)
862    - **IMPORTANT**: "{company_from_context}" and "{company_abbreviation}" are the SAME company - if candidate's company_name is "{company_abbreviation}", it means they work at "{company_from_context}"
863    - This is the STRONGEST indicator after exact email match
864    - Company match is REQUIRED - if provided, candidate MUST work at this company (or its abbreviation)
865    
866 4. **NAME + COMPANY RELATED + RELEVANT TITLE**: If candidate's name matches "{person_name}" AND their current company is related to "{company_from_context}" AND they have a senior title (CEO, Co-founder, President, Chief, etc.) → MEDIUM-HIGH PRIORITY (confidence 7)
867    - This combination is strong for business meetings
868    
869 5. **NAME + COMPANY RELATED**: If candidate's name matches "{person_name}" AND their current company is related to or contains words from "{company_from_context}" → MEDIUM PRIORITY (confidence 6-7)
870    
871 6. **NAME + RELEVANT TITLE**: If candidate's name matches "{person_name}" and their job title is highly relevant (CEO, Co-founder, Executive, President, Chief, Founder) even if company doesn't match → MEDIUM PRIORITY (confidence 6)
872    - For business meetings, senior titles are important indicators
873    
874 7. **NAME ONLY**: If only name matches but email/company don't match → LOWER PRIORITY (confidence 5)
875 
876 CRITICAL RULES:
877 - **EXACT email match ALWAYS wins** - if a candidate has email "{person_email}", select them immediately (confidence 10)
878 - **COMPANY MATCH IS REQUIRED** - if company "{company_from_context}" is provided, the candidate MUST work at this company (or its abbreviation "{company_abbreviation}" if provided). DO NOT select candidates who don't work at this company.
879 - **COMPANY NAME EQUIVALENCE**: "{company_from_context}" and "{company_abbreviation}" are THE SAME COMPANY. If a candidate's company_name is "{company_abbreviation}", they work at "{company_from_context}".
880 - **Name exact match is REQUIRED** - candidate name must match "{person_name}" exactly (ignoring case)
881 - **If company is provided and candidate works at that company** (full name or abbreviation): This is the STRONGEST match after exact email (confidence 9)
882 - **If NO emails are available** (all candidates show "emails: []"), rely on name + company matching
883 - **For business meetings, prioritize senior titles**: CEO, Co-founder, Chief Executive Officer, President, etc. are highly relevant
884 - If multiple candidates match name + company, prefer the one with the highest-level role (CEO > Co-founder > President > VP > Director > Manager)
885 - **DO NOT select candidates whose name doesn't match "{person_name}"** - even if company matches perfectly
886 - **DO NOT select candidates who don't work at "{company_from_context}" or "{company_abbreviation}"** - even if name matches and they have a senior title
887 
888 Return a JSON object with this structure:
889 {{
890     "parent_id": "The parent_id of the best matching candidate, or null if no good match",
891     "confidence_score": 1-10,
892     "reasoning": "Detailed explanation of why this candidate was selected, including: email match status (exact/domain/none), company match, job title relevance, name match, and why this candidate is better than others"
893 }}
894 
895 SELECTION CRITERIA SUMMARY:
896 - Target: {person_name} with email {person_email} from company "{company_from_context}"
897 - Check each candidate's "all_emails" array for email matches (if available)
898 - Check "email_exact_match" and "email_domain_match" flags if provided
899 - **MOST IMPORTANT**: Prioritize candidates where full_name exactly matches "{person_name}"
900 - **If emails are not available**: Rely on name + company matching
901 - For name matches, prefer:
902   1. Email domain matching "{email_domain}" (if emails available)
903   2. Company name matching "{company_from_context}" (strong indicator)
904   3. Senior titles (CEO, Co-founder, etc.) for business meetings
905 - **If a candidate named "{person_name}" works at "{company_from_context}" or a related company, select them** even without email (confidence 7-8)
906 
907 **CRITICAL REQUIREMENT**: If company "{company_from_context}" is provided:
908 - **REQUIRED**: Candidate MUST work at "{company_from_context}" OR its abbreviation "{company_abbreviation}" (these are THE SAME COMPANY)
909 - **IMPORTANT**: If candidate's company_name field shows "{company_abbreviation}", this means they work at "{company_from_context}" - this is a VALID match
910 - **DO NOT select candidates who don't work at this company**, even if name matches perfectly
911 - **ONLY return null if**: No candidate has name "{person_name}" AND works at "{company_from_context}" (or its abbreviation)
912 
913 **SELECTION STRATEGY**:
914 - **If company is provided**: Select ONLY candidates who work at "{company_from_context}" OR "{company_abbreviation}" (same company, different representations)
915 - **If company is NOT provided**: Select best candidate with matching name "{person_name}" (prefer senior titles)
916 - If multiple candidates match name + company, prefer the one with highest-level role (CEO > Co-founder > President > VP)
917 - **Only return null** if: (1) No candidate has name "{person_name}", OR (2) Company provided but no candidate works there (check both full name and abbreviation)
918 
919 Return ONLY valid JSON - no markdown code blocks, no explanations."""
920

1164             # Query for past 24 hours - ordered by tier (1,2,3), confidence (highest first), date (newest first)
1165             query_24h = f"""
1166                 SELECT 
1167                     uf.finding_id,
1168                     uf.radar_id,
1169                     uf.relevance_score,
1170                     uf.priority_tier,
1171                     uf.category,
1172                     f.radar_type,

1174                     f.discovered_at,
1175                     r.radar_config,
1176                     r.radar_category,
